titles.title: Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
To designate the Flatside-Bethune Wilderness in the Ouachita National Forest, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1612.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.
Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry. Reported by Senator Boozman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 219.

committee.name: Senate Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

term.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

bill.summary:
Flatside Wilderness Additions Act
This bill adds specified lands to the Flatside Wilderness in the Ouachita National Forest in Arkansas. The bill also redesignates the wilderness as the Flatside-Bethune Wilderness.
